snippet: Biofuel expansion has contributed to spikes in food prices and a shortage of farmland; both are felt keenly in Guatemala, with its corn-based diet and land owned by a handful of families.
abstract: Expansion of biofuels industry has contributed to spikes in food prices and shortage of land for food-based agriculture in poorer countries; Guatemala has felt both keenly, with its residents' corn-based diet and fact that much of its land, owned by handful of families, has proved ideal for producing raw materials for biofuels.
lead_paragraph: Biofuel expansion has contributed to spikes in food prices and a shortage of farmland; both are felt keenly in Guatemala, with its corn-based diet and land owned by a handful of families.

headline.seo: In Fields and Markets, Guatemalans Feel Squeeze of Biofuel Demand
headline.main: As Biofuel Demand Grows, So Do Guatemala’s Hunger Pangs
headline.print_headline: As Biofuel Demand Grows, So Do Guatemala’s Hunger Pangs
